# AylluCare/B4U - IAM Microservice
## Overview
This is the **Identity and Access Management (IAM)** microservice for the **AylluCare/B4U** rural digital health platform. It follows **Domain-Driven Design (DDD)** principles and uses a clean layered architecture.
---
## Domain Context
**AylluCare/B4U** is a digital health platform focused on rural areas (e.g., Cajamarca, Peru) that automates anamnesis using Generative AI and NLP.
The IAM bounded context is responsible **ONLY** for: - Identity and access management (users, credentials, roles) - Authentication via username/email + password - Issuing JWT access tokens (and refresh tokens) - Role-based access control (RBAC) - Publishing domain events to RabbitMQ for integration
**⚠️ IAM does NOT contain clinical data** (symptoms, allergies, etc.) - that lives in other bounded contexts like Profile & Consent and Anamnesis-LLM.
---
## Roles
The system has exactly **3 roles**:
| Role | Description | Key Responsibilities | |------|-------------|---------------------| | `ROLE_PATIENT` | Rural users | Register, login, interact with AI for anamnesis, view their own data | | `ROLE_DOCTOR` | Health professionals | Login, review clinical summaries, manage cases, issue prescriptions | | `ROLE_ADMIN` | System administrators | Manage users, roles, system configuration |
---
## Domain Model
### Aggregates
#### User - **userId** (UUID/Long) - **firstName** - **lastName** - **email** (unique) - **passwordHash** - **status** (`ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `LOCKED`) - **roles** (Set<Role>) - **phoneNumber** (optional) - **preferredLanguage** (e.g., "es", "qu", "en") - **createdAt**, **updatedAt**
**Domain invariants:** - Email must be unique - At least 1 role is required - New users are `ACTIVE` by default - Passwords must be hashed
#### RefreshToken - **tokenId** - **userId** - **token** (string) - **expiresAt** - **revoked** (boolean)
### Value Objects
- **Roles**: `ROLE_PATIENT`, `ROLE_DOCTOR`, `ROLE_ADMIN` - **UserStatus**: `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `LOCKED`
### Domain Events
Published to RabbitMQ for integration with other bounded contexts:
1. **UserCreatedEvent** - When any user is created 2. **UserRegisteredAsPatientEvent** - Specific to patient registration 3. **UserRegisteredAsDoctorEvent** - Specific to doctor registration 4. **UserRoleChangedEvent** - When admin changes user roles 5. **UserStatusChangedEvent** - When admin changes user status 6. **UserLoggedInEvent** (optional) - For analytics and security monitoring
---
## Architecture
### Layered Structure
``` iam/ ├── application/ # Application services (use cases) │ └── internal/ │ ├── commandservices/ # Command handlers │ └── queryservices/ # Query handlers ├── domain/ # Domain layer (pure business logic) │ ├── model/ │ │ ├── aggregates/ # User, RefreshToken │ │ ├── entities/ # Role │ │ ├── valueobjects/ # Roles, UserStatus │ │ ├── commands/ # Commands (RegisterPatient, etc.) │ │ ├── queries/ # Queries │ │ └── events/ # Domain events │ └── services/ # Domain service interfaces ├── infrastructure/ # Infrastructure concerns │ ├── persistence/ # JPA repositories │ ├── authorization/ # JWT, Spring Security │ ├── hashing/ # BCrypt │ └── tokens/ # Token generation ├── interfaces/ # Controllers and DTOs │ └── rest/ │ ├── controllers/ # REST endpoints │ └── dto/ # Request/Response DTOs └── shared/ # Shared utilities ```
---
## REST API Endpoints
### Base Path: `/api/v1`
### Authentication Endpoints
#### 1. Register Patient ```http POST /api/v1/auth/register/patient Content-Type: application/json
{ "firstName": "Juan", "lastName": "Pérez", "email": "juan.perez@example.com", "password": "SecurePass123", "phoneNumber": "+51987654321", "preferredLanguage": "es" } ```
**Response:** `201 Created` ```json { "userId": 1, "email": "juan.perez@example.com", "firstName": "Juan", "lastName": "Pérez", "roles": ["ROLE_PATIENT"], "status": "ACTIVE", "accessToken": "eyJhbGc...", "tokenType": "Bearer", "expiresIn": 3600 } ```
#### 2. Register Doctor ```http POST /api/v1/auth/register/doctor Content-Type: application/json
{ "firstName": "María", "lastName": "García", "email": "maria.garcia@hospital.com", "password": "DoctorPass123", "phoneNumber": "+51987654322", "requiresVerification": false } ```
#### 3. Login ```http POST /api/v1/auth/login Content-Type: application/json
{ "email": "juan.perez@example.com", "password": "SecurePass123" } ```
#### 4. Refresh Token ```http POST /api/v1/auth/refresh Content-Type: application/json
{ "refreshToken": "your-refresh-token-here" } ```
#### 5. Logout ```http POST /api/v1/auth/logout Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} Content-Type: application/json
{ "refreshToken": "your-refresh-token-here" } ```
### User Management Endpoints
#### 6. Get Current User ```http GET /api/v1/users/me Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} ```
#### 7. Get All Users (Admin Only) ```http GET /api/v1/users?role=ROLE_PATIENT&status=ACTIVE Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} ```
#### 8. Get User by ID ```http GET /api/v1/users/{userId} Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} ```
#### 9. Update User Roles (Admin Only) ```http PATCH /api/v1/users/{userId}/roles Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} Content-Type: application/json
{ "roles": ["ROLE_PATIENT", "ROLE_DOCTOR"] } ```
#### 10. Update User Status (Admin Only) ```http PATCH /api/v1/users/{userId}/status Authorization: Bearer {accessToken} Content-Type: application/json
{ "status": "INACTIVE", "reason": "Account verification pending" } ```
---
## RabbitMQ Integration
### Exchange - **Name:** `iam.events` - **Type:** `topic`
### Routing Keys - `iam.user.registered` - `iam.user.role-changed` - `iam.user.status-changed` - `iam.user.registered.patient` - `iam.user.registered.doctor` - `iam.user.logged-in`
### Event Payload Example
```json { "userId": 1, "email": "juan.perez@example.com", "firstName": "Juan", "lastName": "Pérez", "roles": ["ROLE_PATIENT"], "status": "ACTIVE", "occurredAt": "2025-11-13T10:30:00Z" } ```
---
## Security
### JWT Authentication - Tokens signed with strong secret (minimum 256 bits) - Include: `userId`, `email`, `roles`, `issuedAt`, `expiresAt` - Default expiration: 7 days (configurable)
### RBAC Authorization - **PATIENT**: Can only access their own data - **DOCTOR**: Can access clinical resources in other microservices - **ADMIN**: Can access user management endpoints
### Password Security - Hashed using BCrypt - Minimum strength requirements enforced
---
## Configuration
### Key Properties (`application.properties`)
```properties # Application spring.application.name=ayllucare-iam server.port=8081
# Database (H2 for dev, PostgreSQL for prod) spring.datasource.url=jdbc:h2:mem:ayllucare_iam_db
# JWT authorization.jwt.secret=your-secret-key-here authorization.jwt.expiration.days=7
# RabbitMQ spring.rabbitmq.host=localhost spring.rabbitmq.port=5672
# Eureka eureka.client.serviceUrl.defaultZone=http://localhost:8761/eureka/ ```
---
## Running the Application
### Prerequisites - Java 21+ - Maven 3.8+ - RabbitMQ running on localhost:5672 - Eureka Server running on localhost:8761 (optional)
### Steps
1. **Start RabbitMQ:** ```bash docker run -d --name rabbitmq -p 5672:5672 -p 15672:15672 rabbitmq:3-management ```
2. **Build the application:** ```bash mvn clean install ```
3. **Run the application:** ```bash mvn spring-boot:run ```
4. **Access:** - API: http://localhost:8081/api/v1 - Swagger UI: http://localhost:8081/swagger-ui.html - H2 Console: http://localhost:8081/h2-console
---
## Testing
### Manual Testing with cURL
#### Register a Patient: ```bash curl -X POST http://localhost:8081/api/v1/auth/register/patient \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "firstName": "Juan", "lastName": "Pérez", "email": "juan@example.com", "password": "password123", "phoneNumber": "+51987654321", "preferredLanguage": "es" }' ```
#### Login: ```bash curl -X POST http://localhost:8081/api/v1/auth/login \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "email": "juan@example.com", "password": "password123" }' ```
#### Get Current User: ```bash curl -X GET http://localhost:8081/api/v1/users/me \ -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" ```
---
## Migration Notes
### Changes from Previous Domain
1. **Roles Updated:** - ❌ ROLE_USER, ROLE_MANAGER, ROLE_CARRIER - ✅ ROLE_PATIENT, ROLE_DOCTOR, ROLE_ADMIN
2. **User Entity Enriched:** - Added: `firstName`, `lastName`, `status`, `phoneNumber`, `preferredLanguage` - Removed: `createdBy` (specific to old carrier domain)
3. **New Commands:** - `RegisterPatientCommand` - `RegisterDoctorCommand` - `UpdateUserRolesCommand` - `UpdateUserStatusCommand` - `RefreshTokenCommand` - `RevokeRefreshTokenCommand`
4. **New Domain Events:** - Enhanced event payloads with more context - Role-specific events for integration
5. **REST Endpoints:** - Reorganized under `/api/v1/auth` and `/api/v1/users` - Removed carrier-specific endpoints
---
## Future Enhancements
- [ ] Password reset functionality - [ ] Email verification for new accounts - [ ] Two-factor authentication (2FA) - [ ] OAuth2 integration (Google, Facebook) - [ ] Audit log for security events - [ ] Rate limiting on authentication endpoints - [ ] Redis caching for tokens - [ ] GraphQL API support
---
## Contact & Support
For questions or issues related to the IAM microservice: - Project: AylluCare/B4U - Domain: Identity & Access Management - Architecture: Clean DDD with CQRS
---
**Last Updated:** November 13, 2025

```java package com.microservice.iam.domain.model.aggregates;
import com.microservice.iam.shared.domain.model.aggregates.AuditableAbstractAggregateRoot; import jakarta.persistence.*; import jakarta.validation.constraints.NotBlank; import jakarta.validation.constraints.NotNull; import lombok.Getter; import lombok.Setter;
import java.time.Instant;
@Getter @Setter @Entity @Table(name = "refresh_tokens") public class RefreshToken extends AuditableAbstractAggregateRoot<RefreshToken> {
@NotNull @Column(name = "user_id", nullable = false) private Long userId;
@NotBlank @Column(nullable = false, unique = true, length = 500) private String token;
@NotNull @Column(name = "expires_at", nullable = false) private Instant expiresAt;
@Column(nullable = false) private boolean revoked = false;
public RefreshToken() {}
public RefreshToken(Long userId, String token, Instant expiresAt) { this(); this.userId = userId; this.token = token; this.expiresAt = expiresAt; this.revoked = false; }
public boolean isExpired() { return Instant.now().isAfter(this.expiresAt); }
public boolean isValid() { return !this.revoked && !isExpired(); }
public void revoke() { this.revoked = true; } } ```

#!/bin/bash
# =============================================== # AYLLUCARE/B4U - START ALL MICROSERVICES # =============================================== # Starts all microservices in the correct order # ===============================================
# Colors for output GREEN='\033[0;32m' YELLOW='\033[1;33m' RED='\033[0;31m' BLUE='\033[0;34m' NC='\033[0m' # No Color
echo -e "${BLUE}╔════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗${NC}" echo -e "${BLUE}║ AYLLUCARE/B4U - START ALL MICROSERVICES ║${NC}" echo -e "${BLUE}╚════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝${NC}" echo ""
# Check if running on macOS if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then TERMINAL_CMD="osascript -e" USE_APPLE_SCRIPT=true else TERMINAL_CMD="gnome-terminal --" USE_APPLE_SCRIPT=false fi
# Base directory BASE_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
# Microservices in startup order declare -a SERVICES=( "microservice-config:Config Server:8888" "microservice-eureka:Eureka Server:8761" "microservice-gateway:Gateway:8080" "microservice-iam:IAM:8090" "microservice-profiles:Profile:8092" "microservice-anamnesis:Anamnesis:8093" "microservice-triage:Triage:8094" "microservice-casedesk:CaseDesk:8095" )
echo -e "${YELLOW}Starting microservices in order...${NC}" echo ""
for SERVICE_INFO in "${SERVICES[@]}"; do IFS=':' read -r DIR NAME PORT <<< "$SERVICE_INFO"
SERVICE_PATH="${BASE_DIR}/${DIR}"
if [ ! -d "$SERVICE_PATH" ]; then echo -e "${RED}✗ Directory not found: ${SERVICE_PATH}${NC}" continue fi
echo -e "${GREEN}Starting ${NAME} (port ${PORT})...${NC}"
if [ "$USE_APPLE_SCRIPT" = true ]; then # macOS - Open new terminal tab osascript <<EOF tell application "Terminal" activate tell application "System Events" to keystroke "t" using {command down} delay 0.5 do script "cd '${SERVICE_PATH}' && echo '=== ${NAME} (port ${PORT}) ===' && ./mvnw spring-boot:run" in front window end tell EOF else # Linux - Open new terminal window gnome-terminal -- bash -c "cd '${SERVICE_PATH}' && echo '=== ${NAME} (port ${PORT}) ===' && ./mvnw spring-boot:run; exec bash" fi
# Wait a bit between services if [[ "$NAME" == "Config Server" ]] || [[ "$NAME" == "Eureka Server" ]]; then echo -e "${YELLOW}Waiting 30 seconds for ${NAME} to start...${NC}" sleep 30 else echo -e "${YELLOW}Waiting 10 seconds before starting next service...${NC}" sleep 10 fi
